result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Exavier Vincente Saucedo

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

10:12 AM Defendant Exavier Vincente Saucedo in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Exavier Vincente Saucedo.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Attorney Lawton waived reading of information, stood mute, matter to be set on branch 1 trial calendar. 10:14 AM
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Lippert

records.addlTxt: appointing Atty Lawton
Return date on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Exavier Vincente Saucedo in court. Defendant would like counsel, is not eligible for Public Defender, Court in recess at 9:05 A.M., Case recalled at 9:26 A.M., appearances the same, Defendant filed Petition for Appointment of Counsel, Court appoints Atty Mark Lawton at the rate of $100.00 per hour, Defendant to reimburse Columbia County at the rate of $100.00 per month, commencing 8/15/22
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Standard felony conditions. May return to IL to reside, may not leave IL except to return to WI for court.
Pretrial 7-5-22 at 9:00 am and Return date 7-7-22 at 9:00 am

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Exavier Vincente Saucedo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Claire M Edwards appeared by video for Exavier Vincente Saucedo. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $250.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. Not leave the State of WI except to return to his home in IL and not leave the State of IL except to return to WI for court. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:45 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
